intro: Fumariola turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. It typically blooms in late spring to early summer, adding a touch of color to alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable growing conditions.
